content:
gregdonald said

I receive requests to input my password, and then advised failed.

Make sure the password you're providing is the same one that you're using to access webmail, when Thunderbird prompts you for the password. If the password is input correctly, Thunderbird should not throw a failure message, unless your account settings are incorrect.

Also, you never responded to the reply you got here https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1411604
creator: stancestans

content:
Gmail imposes bandwidth limits as explained here https://support.google.com/a/answer/1071518?hl=en

Your screenshot shows Thunderbird in the process of downloading a large number of messages. The only thing you can do, is limit data transfer between Thunderbird and Gmail. By default, Thunderbird will synchronize/download ALL messages in ALL subscribed IMAP folders. That will quickly hit the bandwidth limit. In Account Settings, however, you can choose which IMAP folders Thunderbird should synchronize, and also further limit the age and/or size of messages that it should download. That's what you should do. Refer to Thunderbird and Gmail and IMAP Synchronization for details.
creator: stancestans

content:
With IMAP accounts, user-created folders can be deleted or unsubscribed, but folders defined by the mail service should only be unsubscribed if they aren't needed.

I suggest you remove the account from Account Settings and the corresponding entries in Settings/Privacy & Security, Saved Passwords, restart TB, add the account as IMAP. Note that the Bulk folder is controlled by AOL's filters, while the (optional) TB Junk controls are separate from AOL's. I recommend using one or the other but not both.
creator: sfhowes

content:
It seems that the issue ran deeper than the Junk folder for my AOL/Verizon account. I finally ended up uninstalling Thunderbird and deleting the associated data folders (note: Thunderbird does a horrible job of cleaning up user data as part of the uninstall process and does not provide the option remove all data). Trying to reinstall without the mainual cleanup lead to a new set of problems. After that, I was able to reconfigure my private domain and Gmail without issue including Google Calendar. The AOL/Verizon account is having new problems which don't belong here.

I now know, based on "sflowers" comment about the name conflict

The AOL folder that should be subscribed is named Bulk, even though it's named Spam in AOL webmail.

combined with the actions I took to cleanup and normalize the account caused the problem.

content:
In Thunderbird, are you using an imap mail account or a pop mail account ? On iphone, are you using an imap mail account or a pop mail account ? What server are you using eg: comcast, gmail, yahoo etc ?

Senario: If you send emails from iphone using a pop account and they are not stored in the server 'Sent' folder as seen when you logon to webmail, then you are not going to see them when using an imap account in Thunderbird because they do not exist on the server.

Please do some tests to find out what is working and what is not.

Phone and webmail Test: Send an email using account on iphone - Use the laptop to logon to your webmail account via a browser. Can you see the email you sent using iphone displaying in the webmail account? And what is the name of that 'sent' folder in webmail account eg: 'Sent' or 'Sent Mail' or 'Sent Items' etc?

Report on results and offer requested info.

In Thunderbird What is the name of your sent folder - eg: 'Sent' or 'Sent Mail' or 'Sent Items' etc ? Is there any filter operating on the 'Sent' folder ? select 'Sent' folder and see if the 'Quick Filter Bar' has any of it's icons highlighted - if anything is highlighted, click on icon to remove the filter.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Okay, for those of you who have had this same problem, I discovered how to "ungrey" the "Set As Default" selection. Go to your default account, click on it, select "Account Actions" and "Set As Default" is NOT greyed out. Click on it. Then go to the account you're trying to set as the default and go through the same process as your original account and the "Set As Default" is now NOT greyed out and you can click on it to select this account as the default.

I know that sounds crazy, but it works.
creator: joemorgan

creator: huben

content:
In 'Write' window, the 'Send' button should display on the 'Composition Toolbar'. If the 'Composition Toolbar' is not displaying : 'View > 'Toolbars' > select 'Composition Toolbar'

The 'Send Now' option is also available via the 'Menu Bar' under 'File'. The 'Send' / 'Send Now' button is not activated until you enter an email address in the 'TO', 'Cc' or 'Bcc' fields.

If you have entered a valid email address in the eg: 'To' field and only see an activated 'Send Later' option then it means Thunderbird is in 'Offline' mode. Click on the 'Offline/Online' icon located in the bottom Status bar to swap back to Online mode.
creator: Toad-Hall
